awd_titl_txt: Seismic Perturbation Methods with Application to Inversion
awd_abstract_narration: This research is to develop theoretical perturbation methods                  towards inversion of seismograms for 3-D earth structure.                       Improved realism in theoretical methods is a field which promises               to yield major new results on earth structure. An important                     application will be to the dramatically improved new data sets                  such as those which the NSF-supported PASSCAL instrumentation                   will produce.  Perturbation methods will be applied to the                      calculation of functional derivatives for seismic inversion.  The               ultimate goal is the simultaneous inversion of both travel-time                 and amplitude for velocity, attenuation and interface parameters.               Because this work will provide basic theoretical analysis                       techniques for a wide range of seismic investigations including                 those anticipated for determination of earthquake-related crustal               structures, it is a contribution to the basic research of the                   National Earthquake Hazard Reduction Program.
